description: Create a markdown document explaining the four core directories and how paths are managed in the project.
instructions: Create a new markdown file at `docs/path_explanation.md`.
Based on the implemented path management system, explain the purpose and default location of the four core directories: `app`, `project`, `output`, and `workspace`.
Describe how the path management singleton works, referencing the relevant code if necessary.
Explain how templated paths (e.g., `{app_path}`, `{project_path}`) are defined and used within the application, providing concrete examples.
Detail how default paths are set within the configuration system and how they can be overridden via the configuration file (`config.yaml`) and command-line interface (CLI) arguments.
Provide clear examples demonstrating how to specify and override paths using both the config file and CLI.
Ensure the document is well-structured, uses clear headings and formatting, and is easy for a new contributor to understand.
Review the `project_dev/rfc/sort_out_paths.md` and `docs/path_management_design.md` for context and design decisions related to path management.
constraints: The document must be easy to understand for new contributors.
It must accurately reflect the implemented path management system.
The document should be written in Markdown format.
validation_criteria: The document clearly defines and explains the purpose and default locations of the `app`, `project`, `output`, and `workspace` directories.
The document describes the path management system, including the singleton pattern and the use of templated paths.
The document explains how default paths are set and how they can be overridden via configuration and CLI.
The document includes examples of using templated paths and demonstrating configuration/CLI overrides.
The content is accurate based on the current implementation.
name: create_path_explanation_document
